item.title: Glowing Ita Bag
item.description:
This project uses an Adafruit Circuit Playground to animate addressable LEDs arranged in a heart shape. The LEDs backlight acrylic charms pinned to a layer of fabric over the LEDs. Animations can be cycled using one of the buttons built in to the Circuit Playground, and the current animation number is indicated by incrementing over the Neopixel LEDs on the board.

  • twitter moment

item.title: LED Protest Sign
item.description:
I made a re-usable LED protest sign. This sign is powered by an Adafruit M0 Adalogger. A text file with messages is stored on the LED card, and messages scroll across the LED matrix. The holder uses a dipswitch to select the message from the text file.

I brought this sign to the March for Science in Washington, DC, on April 22, 2017. Although it was raining, a clear plastic trashbag protected it from the elements, and it survived the march.

DOCUMENTATION

  • GitHub repo

item.title: Glow Cloud Dress
item.description:
This is my cosplay of the Glow Cloud from the podcast Welcome to Night Vale. I wore this cosplay to the 2017 live show in Washington, DC. The live show focused on the Glow Cloud, so I knew I had to one-up my glow cloud from last year. My cosplay was featured on the official WTNV instagram here.

This project uses an Adafruit Circuit Playground to animate addressable LEDs on a hoop skirt. Animations can be cycled using one of the buttons built in to the Circuit Playground, and the current animation number is indicated by incrementing over the Neopixel LEDs on the board.

  • twitter moment

item.title: Cheerlights Christmas Tree
item.description:
The Cheerlights API lets anyone tweet @cheerlights to change the color of all devices connected to Cheerlights. I connected some addressable LEDs to Cheerlights using an Adafruit Huzzah ESP8266. I also designed and 3D printed an enclosure for the electronics.

  • GitHub repo

item.title: Holmes <3 Watson Electronic Cameo
item.description:
This electronic necklace uses an Adafruit Pro Trinket and an OLED display to cycle through portraits of Holmes and Watson as well as a Victorian-style heart with 221B inside (as in 221B Baker Street).

item.title: Neopixel LGBT Pride Necklace
item.description:
This necklace uses an Adafruit Gemma and a Neopixel ring to display LGBT pride flag colors. The wearer can cycle through animations with a button. Code for rainbow, trans, bi, and pan flags is available. A diffuser is 3D printed from white PLA.

DOCUMENTATION

  • GitHub repo

item.title: Glow Cloud Cosplay
item.description:
This was my first Glow Cloud cosplay. I wore it to the Welcome to Night Vale live show in Washington, DC, on April 19, 2016. Molly Quinn tweeted my cosplay. I also wore it to AwesomeCon 2016 and FlameCon 2016. (Cecil himself told me I did a great job and I almost died, okay.)

The main glow cloud is a parasol with addressable LEDs covered in polyfill. It runs on an Adafruit Pro Trinket and has a button to cycle through animations. The baby glow cloud is made of addressable LEDs inside a paper lantern covered in polyfill and runs on an Arduino Pro Mini.
